jma::Morpheme

Detailed Description

Morpheme is a pair of lexicon string and its part-of-speech tag.

Definition at line 22 of file sentence.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

jma::Morpheme::Morpheme (  ) 

Constructor.

The string value of lexicon, POS, base form, and reading form are initialized with empty string, and the index code of part-of-speech tag is initialized with -1, meaning that no part-of-speech tag is available.

Member Data Documentation

std::string jma::Morpheme::baseForm_

the base form string value.

As an example in Japanese, "来る" is the base form of lexicon "来".

std::string jma::Morpheme::normForm_

the normalized form string value.

As an example in Japanese, "渡辺" is the normalized form of lexicon "渡邊", "エキスポ" is the normalized form of lexicon "エクスポ".

std::string jma::Morpheme::readForm_

the reading form string value.

As an example in Japanese, "くる" is the reading form of lexicon "来る".
